dom-audiotrack-sourcebuffer.name: sourceBuffer
dom-audiotrack-sourcebuffer.summary: The read-only AudioTrack property sourceBuffer returns the SourceBuffer that created the track, or null if the track was not created by a SourceBuffer or the SourceBuffer has been removed from the MediaSource.sourceBuffers attribute of its parent media source.
dom-audiotrack-sourcebuffer.title: AudioTrack.sourceBuffer

htmlmediaelement-extensions.name: seekable
htmlmediaelement-extensions.summary: The seekable read-only property of the HTMLMediaElement returns a TimeRanges object that contains the time ranges that the user is able to seek to, if any.
htmlmediaelement-extensions.title: HTMLMediaElement.seekable

idl-def-mediasource-activesourcebuffers.name: activeSourceBuffers
idl-def-mediasource-activesourcebuffers.summary: The activeSourceBuffers read-only property of the MediaSource interface returns a SourceBufferList object containing a subset of the SourceBuffer objects contained within sourceBuffers â€” the list of objects providing the selected video track, enabled audio tracks, and shown/hidden text tracks.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-mediasource-activesourcebuffers.title: MediaSource.activeSourceBuffers

dom-mediasource-addsourcebuffer.name: addSourceBuffer
dom-mediasource-addsourcebuffer.summary: The addSourceBuffer() method of the MediaSource interface creates a new SourceBuffer of the given MIME type and adds it to the MediaSource's sourceBuffers list. The new SourceBuffer is also returned.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

dom-mediasource-addsourcebuffer.title: MediaSource.addSourceBuffer()

dom-mediasource-clearliveseekablerange.name: clearLiveSeekableRange
dom-mediasource-clearliveseekablerange.summary: The clearLiveSeekableRange() method of the MediaSource interface clears a seekable range previously set with a call to setLiveSeekableRange().
dom-mediasource-clearliveseekablerange.title: MediaSource.clearLiveSeekableRange()

idl-def-mediasource-duration.name: duration
idl-def-mediasource-duration.summary: The duration property of the MediaSource interface gets and sets the duration of the current media being presented.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-mediasource-duration.title: MediaSource.duration

dom-mediasource-endofstream.name: endOfStream
dom-mediasource-endofstream.summary: The endOfStream() method of the MediaSource interface signals the end of the stream.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

dom-mediasource-endofstream.title: MediaSource.endOfStream()

dom-mediasource-istypesupported.name: isTypeSupported
dom-mediasource-istypesupported.summary: The MediaSource.isTypeSupported() static method returns a Boolean value which is true if the given MIME type is likely to be supported by the current user agent.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

dom-mediasource-istypesupported.title: MediaSource.isTypeSupported()

idl-def-mediasource-readystate.name: readyState
idl-def-mediasource-readystate.summary: The readyState read-only property of the MediaSource interface returns an enum representing the state of the current MediaSource. The three possible values are:

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-mediasource-readystate.title: MediaSource.readyState

dom-mediasource-removesourcebuffer.name: removeSourceBuffer
dom-mediasource-removesourcebuffer.summary: The removeSourceBuffer() method of the MediaSource interface removes the given SourceBuffer from the SourceBuffers list associated with this MediaSource object.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

dom-mediasource-removesourcebuffer.title: MediaSource.removeSourceBuffer()

dom-mediasource-setliveseekablerange.name: setLiveSeekableRange
dom-mediasource-setliveseekablerange.summary: The setLiveSeekableRange() method of the MediaSource interface sets the range that the user can seek to in the media element.
dom-mediasource-setliveseekablerange.title: MediaSource.setLiveSeekableRange()

idl-def-mediasource-sourcebuffers.name: sourceBuffers
idl-def-mediasource-sourcebuffers.summary: The sourceBuffers read-only property of the MediaSource interface returns a SourceBufferList object containing the list of SourceBuffer objects associated with this MediaSource.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-mediasource-sourcebuffers.title: MediaSource.sourceBuffers

mediasource.name: MediaSource
mediasource.summary: The MediaSource interface of the Media Source Extensions API represents a source of media data for an HTMLMediaElement object. A MediaSource object can be attached to a HTMLMediaElement to be played in the user agent.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

mediasource.title: MediaSource

dom-sourcebuffer-abort.name: abort
dom-sourcebuffer-abort.summary: The abort() method of the SourceBuffer interface aborts the current segment and resets the segment parser.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

dom-sourcebuffer-abort.title: SourceBuffer.abort()

dom-sourcebuffer-appendbuffer.name: appendBuffer
dom-sourcebuffer-appendbuffer.summary: The appendBuffer() method of the SourceBuffer interface appends media segment data from an ArrayBuffer or ArrayBufferView object to the SourceBuffer.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

dom-sourcebuffer-appendbuffer.title: SourceBuffer.appendBuffer()

idl-def-sourcebuffer-appendwindowend.name: appendWindowEnd
idl-def-sourcebuffer-appendwindowend.summary: The appendWindowEnd property of the SourceBuffer interface controls the timestamp for the end of the append window, a timestamp range that can be used to filter what media data is appended to the SourceBuffer. Coded media frames with timestamps wthin this range will be appended, whereas those outside the range will be filtered out.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-sourcebuffer-appendwindowend.title: SourceBuffer.appendWindowEnd

idl-def-sourcebuffer-appendwindowstart.name: appendWindowStart
idl-def-sourcebuffer-appendwindowstart.summary: The appendWindowStart property of the SourceBuffer interface controls the timestamp for the start of the append window, a timestamp range that can be used to filter what media data is appended to the SourceBuffer. Coded media frames with timestamps wthin this range will be appended, whereas those outside the range will be filtered out.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-sourcebuffer-appendwindowstart.title: SourceBuffer.appendWindowStart

idl-def-sourcebuffer-audiotracks.name: audioTracks
idl-def-sourcebuffer-audiotracks.summary: The audioTracks read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface returns a list of the audio tracks currently contained inside the SourceBuffer.

safari_ios.notes: Exposed in Mobile Safari on iPad but not on iPhone.

idl-def-sourcebuffer-audiotracks.title: SourceBuffer.audioTracks

idl-def-sourcebuffer-buffered.name: buffered
idl-def-sourcebuffer-buffered.summary: The buffered read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface returns the time ranges that are currently buffered in the SourceBuffer as a normalized TimeRanges object.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-sourcebuffer-buffered.title: SourceBuffer.buffered

idl-def-sourcebuffer-mode.name: mode
idl-def-sourcebuffer-mode.summary: The mode property of the SourceBuffer interface controls whether media segments can be appended to the SourceBuffer in any order, or in a strict sequence.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-sourcebuffer-mode.title: SourceBuffer.mode

dom-sourcebuffer-remove.name: remove
dom-sourcebuffer-remove.summary: The remove() method of the SourceBuffer interface removes media segments within a specific time range from the SourceBuffer. This method can only be called when SourceBuffer.updating equals false. If SourceBuffer.updating is not equal to false, call SourceBuffer.abort().

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

dom-sourcebuffer-remove.title: SourceBuffer.remove()

idl-def-sourcebuffer-texttracks.name: textTracks
idl-def-sourcebuffer-texttracks.summary: The textTracks read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface returns a list of the text tracks currently contained inside the SourceBuffer.

safari_ios.notes: Exposed in Mobile Safari on iPad but not on iPhone.

idl-def-sourcebuffer-texttracks.title: SourceBuffer.textTracks

idl-def-sourcebuffer-timestampoffset.name: timestampOffset
idl-def-sourcebuffer-timestampoffset.summary: The timestampOffset property of the SourceBuffer interface controls the offset applied to timestamps inside media segments that are appended to the SourceBuffer.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-sourcebuffer-timestampoffset.title: SourceBuffer.timestampOffset

idl-def-sourcebuffer-updating.name: updating
idl-def-sourcebuffer-updating.summary: The updating read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface indicates whether the SourceBuffer is currently being updated â€” i.e. whether an SourceBuffer.appendBuffer(),  SourceBuffer.appendStream(), or SourceBuffer.remove() operation is currently in progress.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-sourcebuffer-updating.title: SourceBuffer.updating

idl-def-sourcebuffer-videotracks.name: videoTracks
idl-def-sourcebuffer-videotracks.summary: The videoTracks read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface returns a list of the video tracks currently contained inside the SourceBuffer.

safari_ios.notes: Exposed in Mobile Safari on iPad but not on iPhone.

idl-def-sourcebuffer-videotracks.title: SourceBuffer.videoTracks

sourcebuffer.name: SourceBuffer
sourcebuffer.summary: The SourceBuffer interface represents a chunk of media to be passed into an HTMLMediaElement and played, via a MediaSource object. This can be made up of one or several media segments.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

safari_ios.notes: Exposed in Mobile Safari on iPad but not on iPhone.

sourcebuffer.title: SourceBuffer

dfn-sourcebufferlist-getter.name: SourceBuffer
dfn-sourcebufferlist-getter.summary: The indexed property getter of the SourceBufferList interface allows the SourceBuffer objects in the list to be accessed with an array operator (i.e. [].)

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

dfn-sourcebufferlist-getter.title: SourceBufferList: indexed property getter

idl-def-sourcebufferlist-length.name: length
idl-def-sourcebufferlist-length.summary: The length read-only property of the SourceBufferList interface returns the number of SourceBuffer objects in the list.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

idl-def-sourcebufferlist-length.title: SourceBufferList.length

sourcebufferlist.name: SourceBufferList
sourcebufferlist.summary: The SourceBufferList interface represents a simple container list for multiple SourceBuffer objects.

firefox.notes: Limited support to an allowed list of sites, for example YouTube, Netflix, and other popular streaming sites. The limitation was removed when Media Source Extensions was enabled by default in Firefox 42.

sourcebufferlist.title: SourceBufferList

dom-url-createobjecturl.name: createObjectURL
dom-url-createobjecturl.summary: The URL.createObjectURL() static method creates a DOMString containing a URL representing the object given in the parameter.

firefox.notes: createObjectURL() is no longer available within the context of a ServiceWorker.

firefox_android.notes: createObjectURL() is no longer available within the context of a ServiceWorker.

ie.notes: If the underlying object does not have a content type set, using this URL as the src of an img tag fails intermittently with error DOM7009.

dom-url-createobjecturl.title: URL.createObjectURL()

dom-videotrack-sourcebuffer.name: sourceBuffer
dom-videotrack-sourcebuffer.summary: The read-only VideoTrack property sourceBuffer returns the SourceBuffer that created the track, or null if the track was not created by a SourceBuffer or the SourceBuffer has been removed from the MediaSource.sourceBuffers attribute of its parent media source.
dom-videotrack-sourcebuffer.title: VideoTrack.sourceBuffer
